title: Introduction to theme61
text: theme61 acts extension ggplot2. made custom theme variety functions change appearance standard ggplot2 graph. Thus, correct usage package create normal ggplot2 graph, add theme61-specific elements. article provides examples help figure elements can change. Refer examples function reference page see full scope package.

title: Introduction to theme61
code: # Set up data mtcars2 <- within(mtcars, {   vs <- factor(vs, labels = c("V-shaped", "Straight"))   am <- factor(am, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual"))   cyl  <- factor(cyl)   gear <- factor(gear) })  # Graph p1 <- ggplot(mtcars2) +   geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = gear)) +   labs_e61(     title = "Fuel Economy Declines as Weight Increases",     subtitle = "1973-74",     sources = "1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     tag = "Figure 1",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "mpg",     colour = "Gears"   )   p1 +   theme_e61(legend = "bottom", legend_title = TRUE) +    scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 40)) +   scale_colour_e61(n = 3) +   add_e61_logo() +    y_title_top_e61(-16) +   square_legend_symbols()

title: Introduction to theme61
code: p1 +   facet_grid(vs ~ am) +   theme_e61(panel_borders = TRUE, legend = "bottom", legend_title = TRUE) +   y_title_top_e61() +   scale_colour_e61(n = 3) +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(10, 40)) +   scale_x_continuous_e61()

title: Introduction to theme61
code: g <- ggplot(mpg, aes(cty)) g + geom_density(aes(fill = factor(cyl)), linetype = "blank", alpha = 0.8) +   labs_e61(     title = "City Mileage Density",     subtitle = "By number of cylinders",     sources = "mpg dataset",     x = "City mileage",     tag = "Figure 1",     y = "density",     fill = "No. cylinders"   ) +   theme_e61(legend = "bottom", legend_title = TRUE) +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 0.6)) +   scale_x_continuous_e61() +   y_title_top_e61(-18) +   scale_fill_e61(n = 4) +   scale_colour_e61(n = 4) +   add_e61_logo()

title: Introduction to theme61
code: df <- economics_long[economics_long$variable %in% c("psavert", "uempmed"), ]  df <- df[lubridate::year(df$date) %in% c(1967:1981), ]  # labels and breaks for X axis text brks <- df$date[seq(1, length(df$date), 12)] lbls <- lubridate::year(brks)  # plot ggplot(df, aes(x = date)) +   geom_line(aes(y = value, colour = variable), size = 1) +   labs_e61(     title = "Time Series of Returns Percentage*",     subtitle = "Drawn from long data format",     footnotes = "Some pointless footnote",     sources = "Economics",     tag = "Figure 1",     x = NULL, y = "%",     colour = NULL   ) +    scale_x_date(date_breaks = "3 years", date_labels = "%Y") +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(2.5, 17.5), breaks = seq(2.5, 15, 2.5)) +   theme_e61(legend = "bottom") +   y_title_top_e61(-25) +   scale_colour_e61(n = 2,                     labels = c("Market Returns", "Unemployment")) +   add_e61_logo() +    square_legend_symbols()

title: Introduction to theme61
code: col_data <- head(mtcars2, 8) col_data$names <- rownames(col_data) col_data$index <- 1:nrow(col_data)  ggplot(col_data, aes(x = index, y = hp, fill = hp)) +   geom_col() +   labs_e61(     title = "Frivolous Filled Column Chart",      subtitle = "For the purpose of showing off the continuous colour palette",     sources = c("e61 Institute", "Another source"),     x = NULL, y = "hp") +   scale_y_continuous_e61(limits = c(0, 250)) +   theme_e61(legend = "bottom") +   y_title_top_e61(-23, fix_left = 5) +   scale_fill_e61(discrete = FALSE, palette = "light")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aaron Wong. Author, maintainer. Elyse Dwyer. Author. Jack Buckley. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wong , Dwyer E, Buckley J (2022). theme61: Create Graphs e61 Institute Style. https://github.com/e61-institute/theme61, https://e61-institute.github.io/theme61/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {theme61: Create Graphs in the e61 Institute Style},   author = {Aaron Wong and Elyse Dwyer and Jack Buckley},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/e61-institute/theme61, https://e61-institute.github.io/theme61/}, }

what: Create Graphs in the e61 Institute Style
title: Create Graphs in the e61 Institute Style
text: package contains functions colour palettes enable create e61 Institute themed graphs know colours use applications.

title: Create Graphs in the e61 Institute Style
text: haven’t already, install remotes package: install.packages("remotes") install GitHub: remotes::install_github("e61-institute/theme61", dependencies = TRUE, upgrade = "always") load R: library(theme61)

what: Making the best use of the features
title: Create Graphs in the e61 Institute Style
text: See package website learn use package features.

what: Do the following before requesting a review
title: NA
text: written tests covering functions added changed. run tests pass. ensured new functions show _pkgdown.yml file. updated DESCRIPTION new package dependencies. updated NEWS.md brief description changes. updated package documentation devtools::document(). updated package website pkgdown::build_site_github_pages().

Add e61 Logo to graph — add_e61_logo
Add e61 Logo to graph — add_e61_logo
Add e61 Logo to graph — add_e61_logo
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +  geom_point() +  add_e61_logo(x=5,5.5,30,35) #> Error in add_e61_logo(x = 5, 5.5, 30, 35): unused arguments (x = 5, 5.5, 30, 35)

text: named vector hex codes containing standardised colour palette Australia, States Territories, capital cities. Places can referenced using variety full abbreviated names.

Australian jurisidictions colour palette — e61_aus_colours

what: Format axes in the e61 Institute style — scale_y_continuous_e61
title: Format axes in the e61 Institute style — scale_y_continuous_e61
Format axes in the e61 Institute style — scale_y_continuous_e61
code: scale_y_continuous_e61(   expand_bottom = 0,   expand_top = 0,   sec_axis = dup_axis(),   limits = NULL,   ... )  scale_x_continuous_e61(expand_left = 0, expand_right = 0.015, ...)

title: Format axes in the e61 Institute style — scale_y_continuous_e61
text: expand_bottom Numeric. Add extra space data points bottom graph. See expansion details. expand_top Numeric. Add extra space data points top graph. sec_axis Adds secondary axis (defaults dup_axis(), duplicates axis), see sec_axis details. Set FALSE hide secondary axis. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::scale_y_continuous, ggplot2::scale_x_continuous name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks computed transformation object numeric vector positions function takes limits input returns breaks output (e.g., function returned scales::extended_breaks()). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. minor_breaks One : NULL minor breaks waiver() default breaks (one minor break major break) numeric vector positions function given limits returns vector minor breaks. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. n.breaks integer guiding number major breaks. algorithm may choose slightly different number ensure nice break labels. effect breaks = waiver(). Use NULL use default number breaks given transformation. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale range numeric vector length two providing limits scale. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum function accepts existing (automatic) limits returns new limits. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. Note setting limits positional scales remove data outside limits. purpose zoom, use limit argument coordinate system (see coord_cartesian()). expand position scales, vector range expansion constants used add padding around data ensure placed distance away axes. Use convenience function expansion() generate values expand argument. defaults expand scale 5% side continuous variables, 0.6 units side discrete variables. oob One : Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. na.value Missing values replaced value. trans continuous scales, name transformation object object . Built-transformations include "asn", "atanh", "boxcox", "date", "exp", "hms", "identity", "log", "log10", "log1p", "log2", "logit", "modulus", "probability", "probit", "pseudo_log", "reciprocal", "reverse", "sqrt" "time". transformation object bundles together transform, inverse, methods generating breaks labels. Transformation objects defined scales package, called <name>_trans (e.g., scales::boxcox_trans()). can create transformation scales::trans_new(). guide function used create guide name. See guides() information. position position scales, position axis. left right y axes, top bottom x axes. sec.axis sec_axis() used specify secondary axis. expand_left Numeric. Add extra space data points left graph. expand_right Numeric. Add extra space data points right graph.

what: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
title: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
text: Select data used map variables aesthetics   produce chart, customise common elements get code reproduce   chart.

title: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
code: e61_chart_maker(   data = NULL,   controls = c("labs", "parameters", "appearance", "filters", "code"),   viewer = getOption(x = "esquisse.viewer", default = "dialog") )

title: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
text: data `data.frame`, can pass `data.frame` explicitly function, choose one global environment loading. controls Controls menu displayed. Use `NULL` hide menus. viewer display gadget: `"dialog"`, `"pane"` `"browser"` (see viewer).

title: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
text: `NULL`. can view code used produce chart, copy   insert current script.

title: An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker
An add-in to easily create plots with ggplot2 — e61_chart_maker

what: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
title: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
text: Simple wrapper around get_stamenmap makes easier overlay map layer geographical data ggplot

title: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
code: e61_map(   bbox = c(top = -33.757742, right = 151.492882, bottom = -34.024779, left = 150.839539),   adjust = 0,   maptype = "toner-lite" )

title: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
text: bbox named vector coordinates decribing extent map, e.g c(top = -33, right = 151, bottom = -34, left = 150) adjust Adjust default zoom value maptype Set default map type e61 style, can change another maptype needed

title: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
text: primary purpose function add map layer major place names roads Stamen's map server plot geographical data.

title: Wrapper function for ggmap to produce a map layer in e61 format — e61_map
code: library(sf) #> Error in library(sf): there is no package called ‘sf’ library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union sa3 <- filter(absmapsdata::sa32021, gcc_code_2021 == "1GSYD") # let's just look at Sydney #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘absmapsdata’   ggplot(sa3) +  e61_map(bbox = c(left = min(sa3$cent_long), bottom = min(sa3$cent_lat), right = max(sa3$cent_long), top = max(sa3$cent_lat))) +  geom_point(aes(x = cent_long, y = cent_lat)) #plot points #> Error in ggplot(sa3): object 'sa3' not found

text: palette Character. e61 colour palette reverse Logical. Reverse colour order. ... Arguments passed grDevices::colorRampPalette colors colors interpolate; must valid argument     col2rgb().

title: Create e61 colour palette — e61_palette
text: Creates discrete e61 themed colour palette.

title: Create e61 colour palette — e61_palette
Create e61 colour palette — e61_palette
text: n Numeric. number levels colour scale. Minimum value 1, maximum 10. Using 6 colours recommended may make difficult distinguish colours. reverse Logical. Reverse standard colour order, defaults FALSE.

title: Create e61 colour palette — e61_palette

what: Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
title: Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
code: scale_colour_e61(   n = 0,   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = TRUE,   palette = c("light", "dark", "diverging", "grey"),   ... )  scale_fill_e61(   n = 0,   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = TRUE,   palette = c("light", "dark", "diverging", "grey"),   ... )

title: Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
text: n Numeric. number colours colour scale, required discrete scales. reverse Logical. TRUE reverses colour order. Defaults FALSE. discrete Logical. Indicate whether use discrete scale. Defaults TRUE. palette Character. specific e61 palette continuous scales. Must supplied continuous scale used. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::scale_colour_manual values set aesthetic values map data values . values matched order (usually alphabetical) limits scale, breaks provided. named vector, values matched based names instead. Data values match given na.value. aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . can useful, example, apply colour settings colour fill aesthetics time, via aesthetics = c("colour", "fill"). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks (scale limits) character vector breaks function takes limits input returns breaks output na.value aesthetic value use missing (NA) values

title: Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
Set e61 colour palettes in scale_*_manual/gradient — scale_colour_e61
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(data = mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, col = factor(cyl))) +    geom_point() +    e61_colour_manual(n = 3) +    theme_e61() #> Error in e61_colour_manual(n = 3): could not find function "e61_colour_manual"

code: labs_e61(   title,   subtitle = NULL,   footnotes = NULL,   sources = NULL,   title_max_char = 45L,   subtitle_max_char = 55L,   footnote_max_char = 60L,   ... )

title: Wrapper function to produce e61 style graph footers — labs_e61
text: footnotes vector footnote text strings. new string prepended \*, \*\*, \*\*\*, etc. Please sensible number separate points include graph. sources vector providing names sources graph. title_max_char Set maximum number characters per line title, default appropriate default graph dimensions e61_save. subtitle_max_char Set maximum number characters per line subtitle, default appropriate default graph dimensions e61_save. footnote_max_char Set maximum number characters per line footer, default appropriate default graph dimensions e61_save. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::labs title text title. subtitle text subtitle plot displayed title. caption text caption displayed bottom-right plot default. tag text tag label displayed top-left plot default. alt,alt_insight Text used generation alt-text plot. See get_alt_text examples.

title: Wrapper function to produce e61 style graph footers — labs_e61
text: primary purpose function correctly format footer   text without requiring user guess put manual line breaks   long footnotes put "Sources:" .   transforming footnotes sources arguments nicely   formatted text goes caption argument ggplot2's   labs() function. Thus, using footnotes   sources, supply caption argument well.

what: Saves ggplot graphs with sensible defaults — save_e61
title: Saves ggplot graphs with sensible defaults — save_e61
text: Designed save ggplot graphs made e61 theme   sensible defaults ensure text size appropriately proportioned   given default sizing. See ggsave details custom function arguments.

title: Saves ggplot graphs with sensible defaults — save_e61
code: save_e61(   filename,   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   resize = NULL,   width = 8,   height = 6,   units = "in",   scale = 1,   dpi = 100,   ... )

title: Saves ggplot graphs with sensible defaults — save_e61
text: resize Rescales graph text. Useful need large small graph use vector graphics format. works saving PNG file format. value 2 doubles graph dimensions. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::ggsave filename File name create disk. plot Plot save, defaults last plot displayed. device Device use. Can either device function (e.g. png), one "eps", "ps", "tex" (pictex), "pdf", "jpeg", "tiff", "png", "bmp", "svg" "wmf" (windows ). path Path directory save plot : path filename combined create fully qualified file name. Defaults working directory. scale Multiplicative scaling factor. width,height,units Plot size units ("", "cm", "mm", "px"). supplied, uses size current graphics device. dpi Plot resolution. Also accepts string input: "retina" (320), "print" (300), "screen" (72). Applies raster output types. limitsize TRUE (default), ggsave() save images larger 50x50 inches, prevent common error specifying dimensions pixels. bg Background colour. NULL, uses plot.background fill value plot theme.

title: Saves ggplot graphs with sensible defaults — save_e61
text: Currently file formats supported .svg   (preferred) .png. SVG modern vector graphics file format   means can scaled size without blurring   becoming pixelated. Use PNG file format vector graphics   supported.

code: theme_e61(   base_size = 14,   base_family = "Arial",   base_line_size = points_to_mm(0.75),   base_rect_size = points_to_mm(1),   background = "white",   legend = c("none", "bottom", "top", "left", "right"),   legend_title = FALSE,   panel_borders = TRUE )

title: e61 themed graph options — theme_e61
text: base_size Numeric. Chart font size. Default 14. base_family Character. Chart font family. Default Arial. base_line_size Numeric. Default line width. base_rect_size Numeric. Default rect width. background Character. Options "white" (default) "grey". legend Character. Legend position, use "none" (default) hide legend. legend_title Logical. Include Legend Title? Defaults FALSE. panel_borders Logical. Show panel borders? Defaults TRUE.

what: Reposition y-axis titles to the top — y_title_top_e61
title: Reposition y-axis titles to the top — y_title_top_e61
text: Moves y-axis titles side (ggplot default) top y-axis rotates text horizontal.

title: Reposition y-axis titles to the top — y_title_top_e61
Reposition y-axis titles to the top — y_title_top_e61
text: adj Either single numeric adjust left right axis titles simultaneously vector 2 numerics adjust axis title separately. negative values move text closer graph panel. Defaults -18 seems work well y-axis 1-3 character-wide values. fix_left Optional. Sometimes value adj argument negative, margins left side graph start cut text. Provide small positive value (5?) correct .

title: Reposition y-axis titles to the top — y_title_top_e61
theme61 0.2.0
text: Adds base map function e61_map() sensible defaults mapping. Improvements automatic discrete colour palette selection. Changes theme fix graphs 0.75 aspect ratio. Added alternate minimal theme called theme_e61_clean(). New add-creates charts based esquisse. Updated save_e61() allow save plots recently generated one. Many functions renamed closely align existing ggplot2 function names, _e61 appended , example e61_colour_manual now becomes scale_colour_e61. old functions now deprecated made defunct future versions. Please stop using use new functions instead.

title: theme61 0.1.0
text: first functional release theme61 containing everything need make graph e61 style. includes ggplot functions customise theme, axes graph elements. Implements e61 Institute colour palette scale_colour/fill_* function provides colour names data files manual access required. Save functions ensure default graphs appropriate sizing dimensions.
